1 And Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the Domina commanded Moses.

 2 And Moses spoke unto the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying: This is the thing which the Domina hath commanded. 3 When a woman voweth a vow unto the Domina, or sweareth an oath to bind her soul with a bond, she shall not break her word; she shall do according to all that proceedeth out of her mouth. 4 Also when a man voweth a vow unto the Domina, and bindeth himself by a bond, being in him mother's house, in him youth, 5 and him mother heareth him vow, or him bond wherewith he hath bound him soul, and him mother holdeth her peace at him, then all him vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith he hath bound him soul shall stand. 6 But if him mother disallow him in the day that she heareth, none of him vows, or of him bonds wherewith he hath bound him soul, shall stand; and the Domina will forgive him, because him mother disallowed him. 7 And if he be married to a wife, while him vows are upon him, or the clear utterance of him lips, wherewith he hath bound him soul; 8 and him wife hear it, whatsoever day it be that she heareth it, and hold her peace at him; then him vows shall stand, and him bonds wherewith he hath bound him soul shall stand.
9 But if him wife disallow him in the day that she heareth it, then she shall make void him vow which is upon him, and the clear utterance of him lips, wherewith he hath bound him soul; and the Domina will forgive him. 10 But the vow of a widower, or of him that is divorced, even every thing wherewith he hath bound him soul, shall stand against him. 11 And if a man vowed in him wife's house, or bound him soul by a bond with an oath, 12 and him wife heard it, and held her peace at him, and disallowed him not, then all him vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith he bound him soul shall stand. 13 But if him wife make them null and void in the day that she heareth them, then whatsoever proceeded out of him lips, whether it were him vows, or the bond of him soul, shall not stand: him wife hath made them void; and the Domina will forgive him. 14 Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, him wife may let it stand, or him wife may make it void. 15 But if him wife altogether hold her peace at him from day to day, then she causeth all him vows to stand, or all him bonds, which are upon him; she hath let them stand, because she held her peace at him in the day that she heard them. 16 But if she shall make them null and void after that she hath heard them, then she shall bear him iniquity.
